definition: to whisper to one another's ear
to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]
suffix for nouns
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
to receive/to answer (the phone)/to meet or welcome sb/to connect/to catch/to join/to extend/to take one's turn on duty/to take over for sb
ear/handle (archaeology)/and that is all (Classical Chinese)

sentences.english: With a quick look the teacher reproved the child for whispering in class.
sentences.chinese: 老师以极快的表情斥责在课堂上交头接耳的同学。

sentences.english: People began to talk and laugh.
sentences.chinese: 人们开始交头接耳并且哄笑。
群众很兴奋，嘁嘁喳喳交头接耳。

sentences.english: And as soon as the old people said, "Poor Emily, " the whispering began.
sentences.chinese: 老人们一说到“可怜的爱米丽”，就会开始交头接耳。

sentences.english: The spectators began to whisper again.

definition: to whisper
a private whisper
to comment/to talk about/to discuss/discussion/CL:個|个[ge4]
to discuss spiritedly (idiom)/tongues are wagging
lively discussion with everybody talking at once
privately/secretly/unobtrusively
to roar with laughter/hoots of laughter/guffaw
to make an (unnecessary) racket (idiom)
lit. crow and peacock make no sound/absolute silence (idiom); not a single voice can be heard/absolute silence
clamorous/noisy/sensational/very exciting
chattering
to snigger/to titter
to prick up one's ears/to strain to hear sth
to look at each other in dismay (idiom)
to gesticulate/to point out/to point the finger of blame
to make a racket/clamour/uproar
